Nice neighborhood vibe, comfy couches, free wifi, and ample seating.
author: kate r.

description:
Atmosphere: 
-Good, quiet place to study because there was no loud, upbeat music, like the Starbucks on California Street.  Instead, they had soft jazz playing in the background. 
-No overbearing conversations from the people sitting next to you. 
-I was able to get a good amount of studying done, more so than I could at the Starbucks.  But I sat in the window seat, which was little distracting because the bus stop was right in front.  I couldn't help but to occasionally look up from my studies at the people waiting for the 38 Geary. 

Coffee: 
-Thumbs down for the decaf Americano.....plus....I was looking for their holiday menu, ie: gingerbread latte, but I guess they don't have anything like that.
author: Lisa C.

description: As a corner coffee shop with large windows on both side, this place has an incredibly inviting atmosphere from afar, especially on a rainy day as you can see patrons sipping coffee on worn sofas and students hunched over their laptops.  But step inside and the coziness morphs into a feeling that you're in a place that's just run down, old, and dingy.  In any case, the drinks and service were solid for coffee shop standards.
author: Mike B.

description: There are better cafes in San Francisco but this one provides all the basics: free wifi, delicious croissant-wiches, artsy painted walls, couches, windows for people watching, and a bathroom. The people who work here are somewhat friendly but I wouldn't go as far as to say they are great. If your order is complicated, you might get a slight roll of the eyes which is totally inappropriate for the variety of orders they surely get from San Franciscans (I'm lactose intolerant and prefer half-caf in the afternoon, what's the big deal?). The wifi cuts out sometimes, the music is usually too loud, and my order has been messed up before. Also, the drinks are not amazing for the strong coffee lover. That said, I still come here from time to time since it is right near my house, and it does the job.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
I don't know too much about the other Royal Ground locations in the city, but this is the one I've frequented most often, for it's close to my boyfriend's place in the Richmond.

The espresso drinks are decent, but not strong enough for my tastes. I simply just get a double. The snacks are also good, I especially like the little Aussie cookie/biscuit things.

Wifi here is *not* free, it's on the $5 a day plan. They also have a couple of computers here for the laptop-less.
EDIT 6/2007: Wi-Fi is now Free at this location.

Seating is plentiful, there are a few sofas and bench/booth type seating. They seem to have recently added a little oasis with plants and a fountain at end of the cafe. I like their corner location with big windows for people watching... there are lots of colorful folk about!
author: Courtney P.

description:
Very nice place for people who loves real but not very strong coffee or mocha. 
Very friendly people working there. 
Free Internet Connection is a great plus, obviously. I come here almost every day to do my home works with a good drink and a nice music as a backround. The place is not very noisy, since many people come here to study or just read their books.
author: Jenna F.

description:
coffee=strong
outlets=everywhere
cheap snacks=bomn
bathrooms=thank god
people watching=amazing
large bizarre mural=intriguing

i could come here more. lots more.
author: Kira M.

description:
The house coffee is good, and the sandwiches are ok.

Avoid the scones, muffins, cakes and bread selections. Also steer clear of the cappuccino.

The environment is pleasant - lots of natural light, and the people running the place are nice.
author: C G.

description:
Perfect spot to people watch, as this is one of the more crowded coffee spots in this area.  Good size coffeeshop & free wifi via ZRNet.  

I do try to avoid this coffeeshop during the weekdays around 11am as the mothers-with-annoyingly-loud-children like to congregate during this time.
author: Johnnyhair H.

description:
This is a great local cafe.  Well lit with plenty of seating to gather round a handful of friends.  The staff are friendly.

And not to mention --  they are right next store to the Original Buffalo Burger joint that has FRESHLY made potato chips to satisfy those naughty eating habits.
author: Mei C.

description: I got a   Burry  drink and the  staff were friendly  and the offer free  Internet  I will go back soon!
author: Lily S.

description: Just a note, the knitting group (also known as Fog City Knitters) no longer meets at Royal Grounds. The group has moved to Plough and Stars on Clement. They still meet every Tuesday at 7.
author: Nicole T.

description:
This place is getting a full 5 stars from me as far as coffee houses go.

Free wi-fi: check
Nice cozy atmosphere for working or relaxing: check
Good coffee: check

As an added bonus the tables around the walls (which is most of them) have pretty good access to plugs so it makes for a good working environment.  They also don't mind if you do a business meeting or two here which is good for me with my virtual office.

The only thing I don't like, but not enough to ding their rating, is the fact that they are cash only.
author: Raven B.

description: I really like this coffee shop.  It is quiet, unassuming and relaxing.  The ice tea is freshly brewed.  I especially like the staff, who are friendly and efficient.  Try the Falaffel sandwich, it is great!
author: M. F.

description: Said this before, but I'm officially boycotting you as of today. Discovered a new Internet problem.  Apparently on the left side of the cafe power consistently shuts off.  GO TO PETE'S COFFEE ITS HASSLE FREE.  U OFFICIALLY SUCK!!!!!
author: Robert M.

description: For a caffeine-fueled, early morning/late night, laptop Web designer, I couldn't ask for much more. There's coffee, free WiFi, a plethora of 3-pronged outlets for your 'puter plugs, some tasty pastries, and even the sandys are good enough to keep you there through a meal or two. It's kind of "out there," on Geary and 17th, but that means you aren't really ever competing for a seat. The music is pretty mellow - "Landslide" by Fleetwood Mac is playing right now at volume that wouldn't prevent me from taking a client phone call. I only wish I wasn't looking out the window at a giant parking garage, but hey, less distractions.
author: Roy B.

description: Cozy lil nook in my hood. salads and mochas are delicious. breakfast sandos are good but not sure if they use a grill or microwave.  wi -fi is free for 90 min to patrons. couches and cheesy french murals on walls are relaxing. staff is family run and friendly. they remember their neighbors and have frequent flyer cards. definitely recommend to all.
author: Alex S.

description:
The Royal Ground on Geary has a pleasant aura that combines abundant natural lighting, sprinklings of green plants,  and a touch of nostalgia.  It's overall layout and decorative schema are what one might call "busy";  Just about every bit of available wall space is either windowpane, wall mural, artwork, or a backdrop for leafy green plants.

The crowd is sizable, solitary,  and remarkably free of posers.  One lone soul perused the pages of a paperback, while the rest of the clientele stared rapt into the glowing LCD's of laptop computers.  Strangely enough, nobody in the place was packing an Ipod...and unlike the Mission coffee shops I've been to, everyone had a PC while nary a soul had a Powerbook.  Light chitchat was taking place at small tables to the West end of the place, but the silence in couch area was extreme.  I've been to solitude-centric coffee shops that host lonely souls yearning for idle chat.  Others house solitary patrons that willingly eschew conversation, rarely gazing up from their task at hand.  But here at Royal Ground, it felt like there was an unwritten but universally accepted code of silence...one I felt I'd be breaking if I dared to chat up the fairly attractive woman that I bumped elbows with as I sat next to her on one of the love-seats.

Windows that form most of the north and east walls combine with sizable green plants and a row of atrium-style windows towards the ceiling, giving a very airy, almost greenhouse-like ambiance to the whole arrangement.  A bank of four overhead ceiling fans add to it's outdoorsy vibe.  Large wall murals reminiscent of an early-Monet take up most of the wall space in the corners.  Alcove-like tables separated by load-bearing beams and smaller plants create zones of isolation for more reclusive customers, while a duo of opposed love-seats creates a pit that tries....and fails...to encourage interaction between strangers.  Two rent-a-PC's sit along side a small library towards the Northwest corner, while a dark hardwood floor is populated with tables and chairs that are broken in but not broken down.

The staff is friendly and helpful.  Pastries are standard issue, and the coffee is somewhat below par.  The music is soft, not too loud, and a pleasant mix of somewhat-hip and slightly-behind-the-times.

Nice place. Great decor. Run-of-the-mill coffee, and third-party supplied snacks.  Beautiful people won't talk to you, but blathering idiots won't mess with you either.  It's a spot to read rather than rabble, and to chill rather that to chat. It's a good place to waste time, but a mediocre place to stimulate the olfactory senses.  And while some may like the vibe, it's a little quiet for my tastes....
author: Mike W.

description: Very good teriyaki tofu sandwich. Much better than I expected for $4.95. Had there been a wheat roll or side salad on tap, we'd easily be talking five stars. Call it 4.5.
author: Jason B.

description: I really wanted to like this Royal Grounds coffee, but time and time again the service disappoints. The female servers are usually doing three things at once, which slows down their bagel toasting abilities, and overall customer service.  They're either gossiping on the phone, to each other, or flirting with a customer.  It's amusing at first and plain annoying over time.  Ladies, can I just have my latte and bagel?  I'm not here for a Korean soap opera.
author: Mai N.

description: I really want to support local businesses but my chai latte tastes like hot brown colored water. Boo.
author: Monica K.

description: I go here sometimes to grab some coffee and a sandwich and try to get some homework done. The people that work here are always nice and my white mocha and sandwich are always tasty. The free WIFI doesn't hurt either! Sadly for me it's always pretty busy making it hard to get a table to sit at. But once I find that table you will see me yelping...instead of doing homework.
author: Nikki O.

description: Royal Ground is a difficult one to review.  I love that they have free wi-fi, I like that there are outlets to charge up, Good people watching spot, and I dig the music they play.  BUT their coffee sans heaping spoonfuls of sugar is so bad.  I am such a coffee lover and not that picky, but their latte made me gag. Their cappuccino is better, but still eh.
author: Josie A.

description: It's ok for a coffee shop. Cool place to sip a cup and look at the free newspapers lying around or surf on your laptop or their stations.  They lose a star for taking so long to prepare anything. Like don't expect your sandwich ready in less than 12-15 minutes. But the food is good, healthy and fresh. No, they don't take debit cards but there's an atm on the premises and you can zip out a 20 if you need to.
author: Kira B.

description: Yes I would drive 35 minutes here from my house on a rainy night just to sit by the window to enjoy the view and the free wifi.
author: Andrew P.

description: This is a really great place for food, studying, and a place to catch up with friends.  The sandwiches are simple, yet delicioso! It's not a loud place, but it's not a quiet place.  Rather, it's just right.  I love coming here to study.  Tons of major bus lines surround this cafe, so it's very conveinient, as well! Did I say the sandwiches are really really delicious? I love toasty bread.
author: Mellie P.

description: The place is OK, and I like the free wi-fi.  But every time I come here and have a tea based drink (iced tea and even hot tea), I end up feeling nauseous after about 20 mins.  It's really too much of a coincidence - I don't get this problem anywhere else, so I know it's not me.  I'm worried about doing them an injustice, but I'm pretty sure something is wrong with the water they're using, like they need to seriously clean and disinfect their hot water machine.
author: Ritch G.

description: Impressive double latte! Open from 6am to 7pm, providing typical coffee drinks, breakfast bagels, sanwiches, and salads.  Has a big selection of torani syrups if you like to add an interesting flavor to your coffee like coconut, Irish creme, or english toffee.  Seating and internet access also available here.  Nice, clean place but I think it would be even better if they were open till 10pm.  It would be a great place to go to after grabbing a show at the Bridge Theater across the street.
author: Micaela M.

description: Cute little coffee shop that is cozy... plenty of seating, so you'll be sure to get seat whenever you decide to go work or read in a cafe and have the crowd around you all at the same time. Never tried to the food there, but the coffee and teas are good.
author: Daisy S.

description:
Consider this-- awful service and moldy pastry!!!!

Let me start off by saying that I heart a good coffee shop, and when I moved into the area, I thought that this free-wi fi abode would be a favorite...until my last visit. Like many grad students who (at the time) lived with 4 roommates, I came to escape so that I could work on one of my many papers. Being a solid believer in supporting privately owned coffeeshops, even when I am not hungry or thirsty, I took a few minutes trying to decide what I would like to eat while looking through some files on my computer. 10 minutes later, I was rudely interrupted by one of the workers who loudly asked, "Are you going to buy anything?" Shocked and taken off guard I said, "Uuuh, yes, can I wait a few minutes?" She responded by saying, "Yeah, but your using our internet, so..." and walked away. Considering even your oldest PC (I'm a Mac gal) doesn't need internet for Word, all I could do was give her my "are you for real?!!" look.

Though I should have left, I tried to ignore the rude woman and order tea and carrot cake. after being a snot and taking a minute to serve me, I received my mediocre "treats," only to discover there was mold on the cake. Then, when i tried to exchange it (yes, I was still trying give them business), the woman had the audacity to try and charge me 15 extra cents for the cookie I had SETTLED on. 

Needless to say, I have found another independent coffeeshop to support that does not have moldy pasteries and has never rushed me to give them my $5!
author: Kirsti P.

description: Liked my "Royal Bagel" with avocado, tomato, sprouts, cucumber and cream cheese.  The perfect healthy breakfast.  I tried the "tea latte's" and am not a fan.  Probably not their fault, I just don't like tea and milk together!  I like that this is more than just a coffee shop coffee shop where you can actually get a healthy sandwich or bagel.
author: Andrea R.

description: -Such a great spot for writing, people-watching and enjoying coffee or tea! This coffeehouse is well-situated with the bus stop for the 38 right outside, making it the perfect spot to drop in for a quick bagel in the morning or a decadent Cafe Mocha at night. They serve Mighty Leaf Tea which is always a good sign in my book. I like the large windows and light that streams in as well as the Aussie Bites.
author: Annelies Z.

description: I like the atmosphere of this coffee shop, minus the family of flies that always seem to be there. There are always plenty of tables and the coffee is decent.  Some of the desserts are good, but stay away from the cheesecake.  I don't think that cheesecake is suppose to be warm and mushy-yuck.  The service is so slow, they can only do one thing at a time-seriously.  I gave them three stars because of their oh so slow service and well I guess the flies too.
author: Monica L.

description: I'm a sales rep who works from home, and when I got up today on this Monday morning my internet was out.  Not feeling like dragging myself into the office which is 50 miles away, i set out on foot for a coffee shop with wireless.  The wireless here is free, which is huge plus for me since I've been here since 9am (it's now 2:30pm) plus they haven't kicked me out yet.  However, I have to say I'm not impressed with the coffee.  I like all the tables, which are conducive to me working.. but man...I may need to get another latte at Peet's on the way home just to wash down the taste.  Food's ok.  I'll probably come back just for the free wifi and close location.
author: kimberly k.

description: Nice spot for a quick deli sandwich and excellent coffee; a calm quiet cafe with a rustic back room; friendly staff.
author: J R.

description: My friend and I were looking for a place to have late night coffee and they were the only place in the immediate area still open!  I'm guilty of being a Peets & Starbucks fan so have never stepped foot in here!  The coffee was very good- nice and STRONG!  And I LOVE that they seem to have the whole line of Ultimate Cookie products!  We plopped ourselves on the 2 couches that they have and they let us stay til 10:20 even though they close at 10.  Nice!
author: Judy K.

description: Free wifi, clean restrooms, affordable and good coffee drinks and lots of seating with outlets everywhere. Royal Ground Coffee, you get 4 stars. Thanks for providing such a warm and relaxed atmosphere for a night of studying!
author: Teresa Y.

description:
what a wonderful way to spend your satuday morning.  sitting on the couch with a cup of coffee and your sesame bagel with cream cheese, avo, tomato, lettuce, sprouts, cucumbers, sprouts, pickles AND jalalpenos!!  the crazy ass bagel gives it that extra oomph to make it to 5 star bliss.  the couch, nice staff, chill atmosphere, plants and small water feature make it even more worthy of stars.  

i recently ventured past the crazy ass bagel to a sandwich.  it was just as tastey and almost as crazy ass as the bagel.  if you get it with everything offered it ends up too tall to fit in your mouth.  at least i don't feel cheated.

anyways, i don't expect high class cuisine from a coffee house, but they do exceed my bagel & cream cheese expectations.
author: jen b.

description: I'll give them 4 stars for being quaint, the breakfast sandwich's are really tasty and cheap. The people are nice, and fast, too. I was very much let down by latte' here. Still not convinced there is good coffee in this city.
author: Ashly M.

description:
Ok, I'm gonna say it.  This is my favorite place to get my study on with a good cup of coffee and free wifi.  I love taking one of those window tables looking out onto Geary and the 38 which comes about every 5 minutes.  I love how there's outlets a plenty to recharge  my laptop when I'm there for over 3 hours.  It is surprisingly quiet compared to other coffee shops, so I can actually get some work  done here.  Friendly workers at the register and making my coffee.  

Parking in this area usually is a bitch, but I have always found parking in the metered lot a block away, and this is at 7pm, during what you would think is the dinner rush.
author: Christine H.

description:
I just moved to the Outer Richmond and a bit of research pointed me to this place. It's cozy, my bagel with cream cheese is good, my cappuccino is not that good, and the people here are very different from what I'm used to seeing in the other cafes I tend to frequent (in the Misson).

The interior is nice. I like places that stray away from uniformity in furniture. It's fun for the whole family (which isn't my cup of tea, because that kid in a stroller over there is loud and a little shit, but some people like that).

The diversity of the clientele merits some recognition, for sure. In comparison to the Mission-Dolores crowd, I feel like the demographics here are astrononically diverse. There are actually old people here! And people who aren't hip! Woah!

The Outer Richmond really needs a shot or two, and Royal Ground seems like it's doing the trick. I will never go to the Starbucks down the street now. Whew!

And the free wi-fi, though expected, is an added bonus because it gets me out of the house and I don't have to feel lousy about stealing my neighbors' internet.

Cheers!
author: Alex C.

description:
This review is for the *laundry* facilities, not the coffee shop.

After doing my laundry at the Fillmore shop for almost two years, I've decided it's not worth it any more.

* Broken machines. There are always at least a few dryers out, sometimes as many as five or six. Sometimes washing maching machines are out too. This isn't always a big deal, but when it's busy, there can be a bottleneck with people with wet clothes waiting around for dryers to open.

* THEY CAN'T DECIDE ON WHAT TIME THEY ACTUALLY CLOSE. I get home fairly late, and I liked Royal Ground because they ostensibly close late, . Unfortunately, they've been too inconsistent about closing time over the last six months to be reliable. I don't know if this is because they're understaffed or what, but it's been incredibly inconvinient.

Half a dozen times at least I've brought my laundry there only to be greetied with a sign announcing "we're closing early tonight! =)". At this point I can't rely on the place being open to a specific time, so I either need to a) plan around them possibly closing early, or b) find another place that closes at the advertised time. I've decided to do the latter.
author: Justin W.

description: This is nice if you have to study and are going to sit somewhere for awhile. It is roomy, nice, comfortable, the tables are not crammed, there are couches as well, there is a good selection of everything
author: Kyrsch K.

description: I go to this place pretty often because its bright and airy inside. Decent jazz usually colors the pleasant vibe along with sunflower-painted tables and a couch. The coffee's decent, all it needs is free wireless!
author: Leti V.

description: I come here when there's work that needs to be done and I need to be away from home but not away from internet. Free internet is of course, going to earn you at least over 3 stars. The sandwiches aren't amazing but, decent. Enough to snack on but not fill up. The coffee's all right, but not very strong. There are tons of outlets where it's not likely you have to fight for a seat with one. Overall it's just an okay place to do some work with some music and coffee.
author: Tiff L.

description: Cheap price, very strong coffee, cozy place and now free wireless can be described in Royal Ground Coffee at Geary and 17 Ave=)
author: Lita J.

description:
It smells in there and the coffee tastes like crap! They always have dirty dishes piled up behind the counter and their menu choices are none existent!

Would never recommend. I'd rather go somewhere else. And their WIRELESS is NOT FREE!! It's with a purchase. Plus there hound you if you don't get something right aways. Totally sucks!
author: Vicki B.

description: The atmosphere is lovely, the coffee very good, and the people who work there are quite nice.  Having said that, I was looking for a good wireless internet cafe.  They had free wifi, *but* it was so slow as to literally be unusable.  Everything timed out, and I had to go elsewhere.  Also, if you drive there, parking is very difficult.  There is pretty much no available free on-street parking and the meters cost $2 per hour.  If they ever get their wifi working well, I'd give this 3.5
author: Julie T.

description: I tried. I really did. Living across the street from here for two years I stopped in for an occassional cup of coffee or a bagel, but the more I drank the coffee the more I didn't ilke it. This is also the kind of place where a bagel with cream cheese consists of a pre-sliced (?) hunk of cream cheese. Gross. The service is also mediocre. Sad. I wanted to like it.
author: Annie L.

description: The wireless is NOT FREE!  When did they start charging???? Usually I will sit at a cafe like this and eat lunch, teas, and dinner while I study.  But they charge for WIFI! No way am I gonna pay for food AND wireless when I'm already paying for it at home.
author: nikki a.

description: this is just your run of the mill SF coffee shop on geary blvd.  i had a pastrami sandwich with a med house coffee, not bad.  i like this spot because i can hang out here if there's a wait at geary salon.
author: Ameer N.

description: this place is great! free internet and the people are nice nice nice. yummy white mochas and bagels too :)
author: Sarah C.

description: great place to bring your laptop (free wifi yay!) and attempt to do homework. except if you're like me and get distracted by shiny little objects. they have good coffee and good customer service! but beware, cash only. very cute little coffee shop with yummy food and drinks.
author: Vanessa M.

description: this place has a damn good mocha. and great music playing every time i've been in there.
author: Jared R.
